items.item: README.txt file with netid, frontend and backend URLs
sample content (different than logged-in content) is accessible from landing page for non-logged in users
Can register a new user and log in
Can logout but then required to login again to view non-sample content
At least 10 preloaded posts exist
At least 3 preloaded comments exist
New posts are persistent to log off and refresh, appear at top of feed
Post can be text only or text with image
Can comment on a post, comments are persistent
Can update a post, is persistent
Can update a comment, is persistent
Add and remove followed users
Suitable message when trying to add user that does not exist
Backend implements all APIs except /locations
MongoDB has at least three collections: users, posts, profiles
No in memory data for posts, users, or profiles.  Always query database or redis session store.
User's feed is provided by an efficient to MongoDB and only returns the 10 most recent posts
Sample data posted to website on submission date exists days later
User passwords are salted and hashed using md5 or encrypted with bcrypt
User can change password, they get a new salt
User can login with third-party authentication
Session is stored in a Redis cache store
JavaScript source is appropriately divided into separate files by component
EXTRA CREDIT: Link and unlink third-party logins with local accounts
